citations.narrative:
The hutch housing the two rabbits is worn in the doorway and the wood is no longer sealed. This area appears to no
longer be substantially impervious to moisture in order to be readily sanitized as required by the Animal Welfare Act &
Regulations.
Correct before the next relicensing inspection.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The environmental enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of birds is incomplete, although appropriate
enrichment is provided. The facility has a documented environmental enrichment plan for the owl, but it has not been
approved by the attending veterinarian and does not address all the requirements. The facility must develop, document
and follow an appropriate plan, approved by the attending veterinarian, and at a minimum must address social grouping,
environmental enrichment, special considerations, restraint and exemptions to the plan, in accordance with currently
accepted professional standards.
Correct before the next relicensing inspection.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 7 December 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.51(d) 
   
Facilities, indoor. 
The hutch housing the two rabbits is worn in the doorway and the wood is no longer sealed. This area appears to no 
longer be substantially impervious to moisture in order to be readily sanitized as required by the Animal Welfare Act & 
Regulations. 
 
Correct before the next relicensing inspection. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The environmental enhancement plan to promote psychological well-being of birds is incomplete, although appropriate 
enrichment is provided. The facility has a documented environmental enrichment plan for the owl, but it has not been 
approved by the attending veterinarian and does not address all the requirements. The facility must develop, document 
and follow an appropriate plan, approved by the attending veterinarian, and at a minimum must address social grouping, 
environmental enrichment, special considerations, restraint and exemptions to the plan, in accordance with currently 
accepted professional standards.  
 
Correct before the next relicensing inspection. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 7 December 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.

n
